sections.title: Key Activities
sections.instructions: What activities are required to meet your value propositions, distribution channels, customer relationships and revenue streams?

sections.title: Customer Relations
sections.instructions: What does each customer segment expect? Which relationships have been established? How are they or will they be integrated? What are the related costs?

sections.title: Key Partners
sections.instructions: Who are your key partners or suppliers? What resources do they provide? What activities do they perform?

sections.title: Value Propositions
sections.instructions: What value do you deliver to the customer? What customer problems are you solving, or needs are you satisfying? How are you solving each?

sections.title: Customer Segments
sections.instructions: Who are your most important customers? Who are you creating value for?

sections.title: Key Resources
sections.instructions: What resources are required to meet your value propositions, distribution channels, customer relationships and revenue streams?

sections.title: Channels
sections.instructions: What channels are right for your customer segments? How do you reach them in the best channels? How cost effective are the segments? How will you integrate the channels?

sections.title: Cost Structure
sections.instructions: What costs are associated with key resources or activities? What are the most important costs and strategies for managing them?

sections.title: Revenue Streams
sections.instructions: What value do you provide that people will pay for? How much and how are they currently paying? How much does each stream contribute to revenues?
